question.text: The qualitative sketches I, II and III given below show the variation of surface tension with molar concentration of three different aqueous solutions of KCl, CH3OH  and CH3CH211OSO3- Na+ at room temperature. The correct assignment of the sketches is -

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">, </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">, </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>:</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msubsup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

solution.text:
Water has large surface tension due to very strong interaction. Generally adding organic derivatives to water decreases its surface tension due to hydrophobic interaction.

In case III, hydrophobic interaction is stronger than case II causing surface tension to decrease more rapidly.

Due to K+ Cl– (inorganic electrolyte) intermolecular forces increases, surface tension increases.
